verses.verse: And Abram<WH87> went up<WH5927> out of Egypt<WH4714>, he<WH802>, and his wife, and all that he had<WH3876>, and Lot with him<WH5045>, into the South.

And he went<WH3212> on his journeys<WH4550> from the South<WH5045> even to Beth-el<WH1008>, unto the place<WH4725> where his tent<WH168> had been<WH1961> at the beginning<WH8462>, between Beth-el<WH1008> and Ai<WH5857>,
unto the place<WH4725> of the altar<WH4196>, which he had made<WH6213> there at the first<WH7223>: and there Abram<WH87> called<WH7121> on the name<WH8034> of Jehovah<WH3068>.
And Lot<WH3876> also<WH1980>, who went with<WH854> Abram<WH87>, had flocks<WH6629>, and herds<WH1241>, and tents<WH168>.

And the land<WH776> was not able to bear<WH5375> them<WH3427>, that they might dwell together<WH3162>: for their substance<WH7399> was great<WH7227>, so that they could<WH3201> not dwell<WH3427> together<WH3162>.

And there was a strife<WH7379> between the herdsmen<WH7462> of Abram<WH87>'s cattle<WH4735> and the herdsmen<WH7462> of Lot<WH3876>'s cattle<WH4735>: and the Canaanite<WH3669> and the Perizzite<WH6522> dwelt<WH3427> then in the land<WH776>.

And Abram<WH87> said<WH559> unto Lot<WH3876>, Let there be<WH1961> no<WH408> strife<WH4808>, I pray thee<WH7462>, between me and thee, and between my herdsmen and thy herdsmen<WH7462>; for we<WH582> are brethren<WH251>.

Is not the whole land<WH776> before thee<WH6440>? separate thyself<WH6504>, I pray thee<WH8040>, from me: if thou wilt take the left hand, then I will go to the right<WH3231>; or if thou take the right hand<WH3225>, then I will go to the left<WH8041>.

And Lot<WH3876> lifted up<WH5375> his eyes<WH5869>, and beheld<WH7200> all the Plain<WH3603> of the Jordan<WH3383>, that it was well watered<WH4945> every where<WH6440>, before Jehovah<WH3068> destroyed<WH7843> Sodom<WH5467> and Gomorrah<WH6017>, like the garden<WH1588> of Jehovah<WH3068>, like the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>, as thou goest<WH935> unto Zoar<WH6820>.

So Lot<WH3876> chose<WH977> him all the Plain<WH3603> of the Jordan<WH3383>; and Lot<WH3876> journeyed<WH5265> east<WH6924>: and they separated themselves<WH6504> the one<WH376> from the other<WH251>.
Abram <WH87> dwelt<WH3427> in the land<WH776> of Canaan<WH3667>, and Lot<WH3876> dwelt<WH3427> in the cities<WH5892> of the Plain<WH3603>, and moved his tent<WH167> as far<WH5704> as Sodom<WH5467>.
Now the men<WH582> of Sodom<WH5467> were wicked<WH7451> and sinners<WH2400> against Jehovah<WH3068> exceedingly<WH3966>.

And Jehovah<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Abram<WH87>, after<WH310> that Lot<WH3876> was separated<WH6504> from him<WH5375>, Lift up now thine eyes<WH5869>, and look<WH7200> from the place<WH4725> where thou art<WH6828>, northward and southward<WH5045> and eastward<WH6924> and westward<WH3220>:
for all the land<WH776> which thou seest<WH7200>, to thee will I give it<WH5414>, and to thy seed<WH2233> for<WH5704> ever<WH5769>.

And I will make<WH7760> thy seed<WH2233> as the dust<WH6083> of the earth<WH776>: so that<WH834> if a man<WH376> can<WH3201> number<WH4487> the dust<WH6083> of the earth<WH776>, then may thy seed<WH2233> also be numbered<WH4487>.
Arise <WH6965>, walk<WH1980> through the land<WH776> in the length<WH753> of it and in the breadth<WH7341> of it<WH5414>; for unto thee will I give it.

And Abram<WH87> moved his tent<WH167>, and came<WH935> and dwelt<WH3427> by the oaks<WH436> of Mamre<WH4471>, which are in Hebron<WH2275>, and built<WH1129> there an altar<WH4196> unto Jehovah<WH3068>.
